intro: Wenzelia platysperma, commonly known as the broad-fruited wenzelia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its composite flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy or open habitats, often in sandy or loamy soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellowish in color. Wenzelia platysperma is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
